dt: {bc}to take a lower court's decision to a higher court for review
{bc}to call upon another for corroboration, {d_link|vindication|vindication}, or decision
{bc}to take {d_link|proceedings|proceeding} to have (a lower court's decision) reviewed in a higher court

et: Middle English {it}appelen, apelen{/it} "to call upon, accuse, make a charge against in court, challenge, apply to a higher court," borrowed from Anglo-French {it}apeler, appeler{/it} "to call, summon, call before a court," borrowed from Latin {it}appellāre{/it} "to speak to, address, apply to for support, refer to a higher authority, call upon, name, designate," from {it}ap-,{/it} assimilated form of {it}ad-{/it} {et_link|ad-|ad-} + {it}-pellāre,{/it} first-conjugation verb formed from the base of {it}pellere{/it} "to beat against, push, strike" {ma}{mat|pulse:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to take a lower court's decision to a higher court for review
